intro: Assonia ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf assonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, round berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Assonia ovata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and pleasant scent.
